text: Psalm 36
Human Wickedness and God’s Love

For the \add music\add* director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh.\f + \fr Ps 36 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
An oracle: the wicked has rebellion
in the midst of his\f + \fr 36:1 \ft Reading with a few Hebrew manuscripts and some versions; MT reads “my” \f* heart.
There is no fear of God before his eyes.
For he flatters himself in his eyes,
hating to detect his iniquity.\f + \fr 36:2 \ft Or “when finding his iniquity and when hating” \f*
The words of his mouth \add are\add* wickedness and deceit.
He has ceased to have insight \add and\add* to do good.
He plans sin on his bed.
He puts himself on a way \add that is\add* not good.
He does not reject evil.
O Yahweh, your loyal love \add extends\add* into \add the\add* heavens,
your faithfulness unto \add the\add* clouds.
Your righteousness \add is\add* ⸤like the mighty mountains⸥,\f + \fr 36:6 \ft Literally “like the mountains of God” \f*
your judgments \add like the\add* great deep.
You save man and beast, O Yahweh.
How precious \add is\add* your loyal love, O God,
and the children of humankind
take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
They are refreshed with the ⸤fullness⸥\f + \fr 36:8 \ft Literally “fatness” \f* of your house,\f + \fr 36:8 \ft Or “temple” \f*
and you give them drink \add from\add* the river of your delights.
For with you is \add the\add* fountain of life;
in your light we see light.
Prolong your loyal love to those who know you,
and your righteousness to \add the\add* upright of heart.
Do not let a foot of pride come against me,
nor let a wicked hand make me to wander homeless.
There doers of evil have fallen;
they are thrust down and not able to rise.
